intro: Microcorys barbata, commonly known as the hairy microcorys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Microcorys barbata is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. It is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
